meanings.definition: Settling an issue or producing a definite result.
meanings.sent1: She made a decisive choice between the two options.
meanings.sent2: The judge will need to be decisive in this case.
meanings.sent3: His coin flip was not very decisive in choosing the winner.
meanings.sent4: The final goal was the decisive moment of the game.
meanings.sent5: The decisive victory secured their spot in the finals.

meanings.definition: Having the power or quality of deciding.
meanings.sent1: The team captain's role is to be decisive in tough situations.
meanings.sent2: Her decisive leadership led the team to success.
meanings.sent3: The cat's decisive meow demanded attention.
meanings.sent4: The decisive tone in his voice left no room for argument.
meanings.sent5: The decisive action taken by the president saved lives.

meanings.definition: Resolute or determined in making decisions.
meanings.sent1: He was decisive in his plan to start a new business.
meanings.sent2: She showed a decisive attitude when faced with challenges.
meanings.sent3: The decisive squirrel was determined to get the nut.
meanings.sent4: Her decisive nature inspired others to follow her lead.
meanings.sent5: The decisive student never wavered in pursuing his goals.
